page.title: 04Ecology_Pouk Hill Quarry
page.content: As well as looking at the rocks of the quarry we also had a look at the plants that grow there now. As it has been disused for about eighty years all sorts of plants have been allowed to grow and now cover almost all the quarry. There are a few bare patches where you can still see the rock that used to be quarried. We discovered three main areas in thw quarry. In the north there is a flattish part. This is where it was filled with rubbish and grassed over. We called this area 1. This leads to the floor of the quarry which is much lower (area 2) and there are three steep sides around the western,eastern and southern parts (area 3).The commonest plant in area 1 is grass with buttercups and daisies. Area 2 is rosebay willow herb and tall grasses. There are willow,alders, and oak trees
